test_message: Extract all compliance rules from the uploaded investment guidelines. Include limits, restrictions, thresholds, and flag any ambiguous language.

extracted_rules.description: The strategy aims to provide a total return that exceeds the Custom Account Benchmark by 60 basis points (gross of fees) per annum over a full market cycle.
Target long-term ex-ante tracking error of up to 100-150 basis points to the Account Benchmark per annum.
All instruments must satisfy UCITS regulations.

Permitted security types include fixed and floating rate, senior and subordinated debt obligations issued or guaranteed by corporations, sovereigns, agencies, supranationals, GSEs, and government-guaranteed entities.

The Custom Account Benchmark is a blend: 48.12% Bloomberg Global Aggregate Corporate Bond Index, 42.31% Citi World Government Bond Ex CNY, 9.57% Bloomberg US Corporate High Yield 2% Issuer Capped Index.
Credit ratings will be measured using middle of three or lower of two in case of split ratings between S&P, Moody’s and Fitch.
FX Forwards may be used for hedging purposes only.
Securities issued by companies in the ESG exclusion list (Appendix I) are ineligible.
Any securities not included in the eligible country list (Appendix II) by country of risk are ineligible.
Direct investment into securitizations in scope of EU regulation 2017/2402 is not permitted.
Investment in funds and ETFs is not permitted.
Investment in physical commodities, commodity futures, physical real estate properties, and bank loans is not permitted.
No purchase or sale of securities from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. or affiliates, or any company named "Goldman Sachs".
Equity investment is prohibited unless received via corporate action/restructure event.
Maximum settled date cash is 10% of account value under normal circumstances.
Currency deviation from the benchmark must be within ±0.5%. Account must be 100% hedged with permitted drift.
Leverage is not permitted.
Securities lending is not permitted.

If the account deviates from a constraint limit due to passive breach, the manager must notify MAS as soon as practical and use best efforts to bring the account into compliance within 10 business days. Passive breaches do not constitute a breach.
In case of an active breach, the Advisor must promptly notify the client and restore compliance as soon as practicable.

ambiguous_rules.text: The list of companies may be updated in writing as agreed between parties. GS may not be able to readily sell securities that are intended for exclusion from the Portfolio (for example, due to liquidity issues or for other reasons outside of GS’s control), however, will seek to divest as soon as reasonably possible in an orderly manner and in the best interests of investors.
ambiguous_rules.reason: Phrases like 'as soon as reasonably possible' and 'orderly manner' are subjective and lack specific timelines, which may be open to interpretation.

ambiguous_rules.text: If the Account deviates from one of the constraint limits Fixed Income shall notify MAS of such passive breach as soon as practical, and shall use reasonable best efforts to bring the account into compliance within ten (10) Business Days.
ambiguous_rules.reason: Terms 'as soon as practical' and 'reasonable best efforts' are vague. The 10 days is clear, but earlier steps are not specifically defined.

ambiguous_rules.text: Passive breaches will not constitute a breach of the investment guidelines.
ambiguous_rules.reason: Lack of definition on what exactly constitutes 'passive breach' may cause interpretation differences.
